@graph.title: The Sage handbook of sport management
abstract: "The SAGE Handbook of Sport Management draws together the best current research on the major topics relevant to the field of sports management, including leadership, gender, diversity, development, policy, tourism and media. Edited by two of the most respected figures in the field, the handbook includes contributions from leading sport management academics from Australia, Canada, New Zealand, USA, the UK and Europe."--book cover

Part 1: Sport management fundamentals -- Sport management / Russell Hoye & Milena M. Parent -- Sport governance / Russell Hoye -- Strategic management / Mike Szymanski & Richard A. Wolfe -- Organizational structure / Danny O'Brien and Lisa Gowthorp -- Human resource management / Tracy Taylor -- Leadership in sport management / Packianathan Chelladurai and John J. Miller -- Organizational culture / Eric MacIntosh -- Financial management / Dennis Coates and Pamela Wicker -- Sport marketing / Aaron C.T. Smith -- Performance management / Joanne MacLean -- Part 2: Sport management challenges and issues-- Sport policy and politics / Barrie Houlihan -- Regulating sport / Bob Stewart -- Sports development / Michael P. Sam -- Sport for development and peace / Simon C. Darnell and David Marchesseault -- Program evaluation / Katie Misener -- Interorganizational relationships in sport / Kathy Babiak and Annick Willem -- Gender issues / Sally Shaw -- Diversity and inclusion in sport / George B. Cunningham -- Sport and the media / Matthew Nicholson and Merryn Sherwood -- Sport brands and consumers / Dana Ellis -- Sport sponsorship and endorsements / T. Bettina Cornwell -- Sports tourism / Mike Weed -- Event bidding, legacy, and leverage / Laurence Chalip -- Event management / Milena M. Parent -- Volunteer management / Graham Cuskelly -- Stadia management / Robin Ammon -- The economics of sport / Stephanie Gerretsen and Mark S. Rosentraub -- Industrial relations in sport / Dan Mason -- Corporate social responsibility / Aubrey Kent -- Sport, the natural environment, and sustainability / Greg Dingle
